page.title: 04The Luncheon Club
page.content: Everyone seems to enjoy our Luncheon Club at Clutton School which we have every Thursday at 1pm. We can do this because there are now fewer children in the village school and they have the space for us.The school cook provides dinner for up to 20 people from the surrounding districts. It gives people a purpose to meet because 1985 is very much the age of the motorcar and people no longer walk as much. When we don't meet in the natural course of the day it makes for quite a lot of loneliness especially in the older generation. After lunch we are able to sit and talk,play cards or just socalise. Sometimes the children come in the hall and talk to us whilst we have a cup of tea until we are ready to depart to our homes.
